title: Standard form of a circle
text: The standard form of a circle is $${\left(x-h\right)}^2+{\left(y-k\right)}^2=r^2$$.
speech: The standard form of a circle is  parentheses x minus h,  squared plus, parentheses y minus k,  squared is equal to r squared .
pacedSpeech: The standard form of a circle is    x minus h,  squared plus,  y minus k,  squared is equal to r squared

title: Center
text: The center of an equation of a circle in standard form is (h,k). We can rewrite the equation as $${\left(x-\left(-2\right)\right)}^2+{\left(y-5\right)}^2=2^2$$. From here we get the center is $$(-2,5)$$.
speech: The center of an equation of a circle in standard form is (h,k). We can rewrite the equation as  parentheses, x minus negative 2,  squared plus, parentheses y minus 5,  squared is equal to 2 squared . From here we get the center is , parentheses, negative 2 comma 5,  .

. From here we get the center is  , , negative 2 comma 5,

title: Radius
text: The radius of an equation of a circle in standard form is simply the $$r$$ value. Note that in the standard form of the circle, $$r$$ is squared. We can rewrite the equation as $${\left(x-\left(-2\right)\right)}^2+{\left(y-5\right)}^2=2^2$$. From here we get the radius is $$2$$.
speech: The radius of an equation of a circle in standard form is simply the  r  value. Note that in the standard form of the circle,  r  is squared. We can rewrite the equation as , parentheses, x minus negative 2,  squared plus, parentheses y minus 5,  squared is equal to, 2 squared . From here we get the radius is  2 .
